div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, February 11, 1914
div1.p:
I believe Mary answered your letter
yesterday - but from what she said I am
afraid that you will consider my opinion
about the Monday club I mean something like the “permission” Mrs Crab-
tree had to dance the Cake Walk. No My
Dear. I see not the slightest reason why you
should not talk, & write, of Panama, or Mala-
ria, in any way you choose to any peone
or set of people you feel like enlighten-
ing. Frankly I suspect Field is right a-
bout Driver - not “Drier” - & that he. D. is
desireous of exploiting himself, Neverthe-
less. the wider Knowledge of Malaria & of
Anti-Malarial Measures is diffused - the better
it is for the South & S. West. & this is true no
C1
B20
matter why the knowledge is diffused. Do you re-
member what St. Paul says of the
Preaching of Christ of Contention?
“nevertheless Christ is preached”
so I feel about the diffusion
Feb 11/14
Dear Dr. Harlan:
I am sending the two patients- White
& Henriquez - of whom your chief of staff
so kindly said he would see
of this knowledge & after all I don't know
that D. is mainly trying to exploit himself. It
maybe that he has taken the best way to worth
work, only I doubt it.

Nevertheless now. I see no reason why you sh'd
not talk to the Monday Club - none whatever-
D The newspaper notices are no more than one sees of
girls in society events - & as you say are not
meant to advertise you but the Anti-Mal. Socie-
ty. Frankly I think the teaching it in schools
an excellent idea - & the taking of the children- was
of 14 & over out to show them - (a) A. breeding places
C1
B20
3
& (b) A. larvae. & (c) the difference between
A. & other larvae - Culex in Va. except in big
seaport towns, - is worth a great deal too- In-
deed the demonstration clinches the didac-
tic lesson. Both our E & I, did that
in N. C.. He rather extensively as the
schools were in operation when he was
there. I showed them to the Roanake Rapid
schools & had quite a “tag” of boys at Eden-
ton: Hertford: Fayetteville & Tarboro, although
schools were not open then.

Did you notice how I had to correct the measures
of preventing breeding places? The list sent laid-
far more stress on breaking up stegomyia breed-
ing places than those of A,. I was very gentle with
the lessons however & in the main they are correct
or correct e--
Dear Dr Harlan:
I am sending with this the two
Patients., White & Henriquez, of whom
I spoke to your Chief-of-staff this mor-
ning. for such advice Please advise me if White is read-
y for operation. & I would be glad if you
can give me
enough & will do good. See if you can get
me the “Rules” Bass got up for them
- they are rules to prevent malaria. I w'd like to see
them. I will not be able to come by
Norfolk - at least not to state - on my trip to
N. C. I expect to go Monday but have not
heard
from my request for leave
yet. It was made provisionally - on an officer
being sent in my place. I am going over to see
Helen tomorrow. E. is not going with me
wishes not to go
